intro: Pavetta albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed pavetta, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, pale green stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Pavetta albicaulis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and swampy areas.
